name: astringently
content:
astringently adverb
(TASTE/SMELL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that tastes or smells dry, sour, and slightly bitter: The salad was astringently bitter. We snacked on astringently sour discs of white radish.
More examplesFewer examplesDespite feeling the chocolate had an astringently "burnt" character, she found it pleasing.Bowls of hazelnuts and chicken came dressed astringently with oil and lemon. The drink is summmery, slightly sweet but still astringently punchy.Everything smelled astringently clean.
